messages.message:
@Serena thanks for clear reply! In the case of table extraction, as a user if I know the names of the tables then I would be able to write better prompts. Is this table information visible to the user (i.e. list of tables found in document + their names)? And where is that second screenshot from?

The documents there were used for testing the configured solution. Here are the docs used to configure the actual solution

• yes indeed, the table names are important, but rn we don’t show them at all in the UI :disappointed: let’s create an EPD ticket for this!
• in TDF, for each document, we generate a `.db` file that constructs a SQL table for each table entity. the second screenshot captures the content of the `.db` file for this VAN ELLE document
    ◦ you can view this file here https://aihub.instabase.com/apps/text-editor/ib-internal/hamish.campbell.aihubprod_ins[…]d_Van%20Elle%20Casualty%20Chubb%20CCE%202022.pdf.ibdoc_0.db (https://aihub.instabase.com/apps/text-editor/ib-internal/hamish.campbell.aihubprod_instabase.com/fs/Instabase%20Drive/aihub/c2785529-c132-4d36-aba6-1a66fa665412/documents/out/original/db_folder/4d2be6cb-0a5a-4cad-ae06-2b690eebe9c8__VAN%20ELLE%20HOLDINGS%20PLC%20-%20CASUALTY%20RENEWAL%20-%2030TH%20APRIL%202022%20-%20Annotated_Van%20Elle%20Casualty%20Chubb%20CCE%202022.pdf.ibdoc_0.db)
    ◦ you’ll need access to the IB internal platform on prod to see that link, and i just gave you access, so you should be able to open that link
i think i have this discussion with the TDF team about jus putting table name in the table highlight UI :stuck_out_tongue: cc @Varun Jain can be a feature we add easily
Agree - this would be incredibly useful
Yes this is relatively easy to add and surface back in the UI. I can create a quick EPD ticket on this.
